member.name: M:SharpVectors.Renderers.Forms.SvgPictureBox.CreateEmptySvgDocument
member.summary: Create an empty SvgDocument and GdiRenderer for this control. The empty SvgDocument is returned. This method is needed only in situations where the library user needs to create an SVG DOM tree outside of the usual window Src setting mechanism.

member.summary: This converts the specified structure to a structure.
member.returns: The structure that is converted from the specified structure.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.IgnoreRootViewbox
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate turning off viewbox at the root of the drawing.
member.value:
For image outputs, this will force the original size to be saved.
The default value is .
member.remarks:
There are reported cases where are diagrams displayed in Inkscape program, but will not show when converted. These are diagrams on the drawing canvas of Inkspace but outside the svg viewbox.
When converted the drawings are also converted but not displayed due to clipping. Setting this property to will clear the clipping region on conversion.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.EnsureViewboxSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate preserving the original viewbox size when saving images.
member.value:
For image outputs, this will force the original size to be saved.
The default value is . However, the ImageSvgConverter converted sets this to by default.
member.remarks: Setting this to will cause the rendering process to draw a transparent box around the output, if a viewbox is defined. This will ensure that the original image size is saved.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.EnsureViewboxPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate applying a translate transform to the viewbox to ensure it is visible when rendered.
member.value:
This determines whether a transformation is applied to the rendered drawing. For drawings where the top-left position of the viewbox is off the screen, due to negative values, this will ensure the drawing is visible.
The default value is . Set this value to if you wish to apply your own transformations to the drawings.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.CultureInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the main culture information used for rendering texts.
member.value: An instance of the specifying the main culture information for texts. The default is the English culture.

remarks.para: The library does not currently provide any means of splitting texts into its multi-language parts.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.NeutralCultureInfo
member.summary: Gets the neutral language for text rendering.
member.value: An instance of the specifying the neutral culture information for texts. The default is the English culture.
member.remarks: For vertical text rendering, there is a basic text splitting into Western and other languages. This culture information is used to render the Western language part, and the mains culture information for the other languages.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.DefaultFontName
member.summary: Gets or sets the default font family name, which is used when a text node does not specify a font family name.
member.value: A string containing the default font family name. The default is the Arial Unicode MS font, for its support of Unicode texts. This value cannot be or empty.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.DefaultFontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the globally available default font family.
member.value: An instance of the specifying the globally available font family. The default is Arial font (since Arial Unicode MS is no longer shipped by MS). family.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.GenericSerif
member.summary: Gets or set the globally available generic serif font family.
member.value: An instance of specifying the generic serif font family. The default is Times New Roman font family.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.GenericSansSerif
member.summary: Gets or set the globally available generic sans serif font family.
member.value: An instance of specifying the generic sans serif font family. The default is Tahoma font family.
member.remarks: The possible font names are Tahoma, Arial, Verdana, Trebuchet, MS Sans Serif and Helvetica.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.GdiRenderingSettings.GenericMonospace
member.summary: Gets or set the globally available generic Monospace font family.
member.value: An instance of specifying the generic Monospace font family. The default is MS Gothic font family.

member.summary: Gets or set the location of the gradient stop within the gradient vector.

member.name: T:SharpVectors.Renderers.Gdi.GdiGraphicsListenerImpl.GdiGraphicsContainerImpl
member.summary: Wraps a GraphicsContainer because it is sealed. This is a helper for GraphicsWrapper so that it can save multiple container states. It holds the containers for both the idMapGraphics and the main graphics being rendered in the GraphicsWrapper.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Renderers.Gdi.GdiHitTestHelperImpl._colorCounter
member.summary: A counter that tracks the next hit color.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Renderers.Gdi.GdiHitTestHelperImpl._colorMap
member.summary: Maps a 'hit color' to a graphics node.
member.remarks: The 'hit color' is an integer identifier that identifies the graphics node that drew it. When 'hit colors' are drawn onto a bitmap (ie. id-mapppe raster the 'hit color' of each pixel with the help of color map can identify for a given x, y coordinate the relevant graphics node a mouse event should be dispatched to.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Renderers.Gdi.GdiHitTestHelperImpl._idMapRaster
member.summary: A bitmap image that consists of 'hit color' instead of visual color. A 'hit color' is an integer identifier that identifies the graphics node that drew it. A 'hit color' can therefore identify the graphics node that corresponds an x-y coordinates.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Renderers.Gdi.GdiHitTestHelperImpl.IdMapRaster
member.summary: Gets the image map of the rendered Svg document. This is a picture of how the renderer will map the (x,y) positions of mouse events to objects. You can display this raster to help in debugging of hit testing.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Renderers.Gdi.GdiHitTestHelperImpl.HitTest(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the topmost object of a hit test by specifying a Point.
member.param: The X-value of the point to hit test against.
The Y-value of the point to hit test against.
member.returns: The hit test result of the renderer, returned as a type.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Renderers.Gdi.GdiHitTestHelperImpl.GetNextHitColor(SharpVectors.Dom.Svg.SvgElement)
member.summary: Allocate a hit color for the specified graphics node.
member.param: The SvgElement object for which to allocate a new hit color.
member.returns: The hit color for the SvgElement object.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Renderers.Gdi.GdiHitTestHelperImpl.GetElementFromColor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Gets the SvgElement object that corresponds to the given hit color.
member.param: The hit color for which to get the corresponding SvgElement object.
member.remarks: Returns null if a corresponding SvgElement object cannot be found for the given hit color.
member.returns: The SvgElement object that corresponds to the given hit color
